meanings.definition: A large bag or suitcase with handles for carrying clothes and other personal belongings.
meanings.sent1: I packed all my clothes in the holdall for our trip.
meanings.sent2: The holdall was heavy with all my belongings.
meanings.sent3: The holdall looked like a giant pillow stuffed with clothes.
meanings.sent4: Her holdall was a portable closet on her shoulder.
meanings.sent5: The holdall bulged with all the souvenirs she bought.

meanings.definition: To contain or be capable of containing.
meanings.sent1: The box can holdall the toys you have.
meanings.sent2: The jar could holdall the marbles easily.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if the bucket can holdall all the water from the well.
meanings.sent4: His heart seemed to holdall the love in the world.
meanings.sent5: The basket managed to holdall the apples without spilling any.
